metadata.title: CVE-2017-16547 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The DrawImage function in magick/render.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 does notproperly look for pop keywords that are associated with push keywords,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (negativestrncpy and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impactvia a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm5').
